column4: So I have this weird issue with my internal dns server, I was wondering if anyone could help? It appears if I try to ping/resolve any hostnames that the internal dns provides, it takes _forever_, but external dns works fine.
how long for dig?
2msecs on one client
and ms of ping?
Excuse me, that's wrong. 909 msecs for dig
wow
Amazing, ping _reports_ accurate statistics, but it takes _forever_ to actually ping.
luis_: Live cd?
accurate statistics like what?
I have  zywall router that's on this network, only my ubuntu machines seem to have trouble with it.
like the same as directly pinging the ip, < 1.5ms.
It just moves in extra-slow motion, like it takes forever to send the packet, but it comes back immediately
pastbin some stuff... did you ntpdate
I'll give you anything you wanna know. Just tell me what you need?
do you have >1 dns server listed?
No, just one, my zywall 10.1.10.1
The Zywall's DNS is setup to contact comcast's dns servers if it doesn't know an address.
and dig taks a long time for local and foreign lookups?
gtg eat good luck, you could test with a second dns server (just install it on an ubuntu box) and see if you get the same thing
Thanks. I'm getting around it by adding certain things in the hosts file. lol
